result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Scherper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Matthew Scherper not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Matthew Scherper.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense counsel unsure as to the location of Mr. Scherper in custody.  Court scheduled a restitution hearing.  No objection from the parties. Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Scherper appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Matthew Scherper.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 8 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 6 MONTHS condition time imposed and stayed and to be used at the department's discretion.  The Court granted Huber release for work and treatment.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Maintain employment. 
- No use of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- NO CONTACT with Mobil gas station in Glendale and Village Ace Hardware in Glendale.


Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given. 

Court allows transfer of probation to Ozaukee County.  Parties inform the court that Mr. Scherper has a plea and sentencing scheduled in Ozaukee County on September 29, 2022.  Court scheduled a status conference to allow Defense time to figure out where defendant will be held in custody after sentencing in Ozaukee County.  Court waives any restitution time limits and will schedule a restitution hearing at the next court date.  Case adjourned to status conference in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
